ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I found this an immensely interesting and useful class. The intensive course structure was challenging but it also meant I was able to focus on the course in some depth for those two weeks. It was a bit too challenging to keep on top of all the reasons. Fewer, key readings would have been useful. I also think a slightly more structured draft delivery schedule for the second half of semester would have been useful. For example two pre-determined dates that draft texts would have been due by. Overall I loved this course and gained a lot out of it.

The best thing about the instructors is their dedication to the course. They are genuinely passionate about the subject and have A LOT of professional experience, they are open and willing to share their knowledge and contacts. It depends on the student wether you take advantage of it or not.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: My favorite part of this course was learning from both Professors' practical experience. Both have fascinating backgrounds in international and comparative law, and it was very interesting to hear their views on class concepts. Those were the biggest takeaways for me.

The final paper was the most interesting aspect of the course to me and I learnt a lot during the process. I also really enjoyed the lectures and hearing about the professors' first hand experiences with environmental law.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: It is hard to maintain the same level of commitment and interest throughout the semester. A student would need to be very motivated to take the course and make the most of it. The two week intensive lectures are exhausting, and following-up with the professors via long distance is hard, but worth it. I cannot emphasize enough how much it depends on every student, because the professors are wonderful and remain interested and available.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to get an introduction into environmental law and I was keen on receiving a broader, international introduction rather than a US focused law program. This course was perfect for me, it was diverse, it was international and it gave me a good intro into both law in general but also environmental law.

Because I wanted to learn about environmental law from an international perspective. I was not interested in the more detailed aspects of the American legal system but rather more holistic approaches to environmental law across the globe.

I have a law background and wanted to learn more international environmental law theory. This is not the best class for that, as most of the learning is done through the term paper - but it does provide a wonderful opportunity for non-lawyers to learn the basics and how to do a comparative approach; and for lawyers to specialize in a specific topic through their paper. Getting to know the instructors is also an invaluable opportunity.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes - this course provided me with an understanding of comparative law and how different legal systems developed, which is exactly what I wanted from the course.

I have a law background and wanted to learn more international environmental law theory. This is not the best class for that, as most of the learning is done through the term paper - but it does provide a wonderful opportunity for non-lawyers to learn the basics and how to do a comparative approach; and for lawyers to specialize in a specific topic through their paper. Getting to know the instructors is also an invaluable opportunity.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Strongly recommend but be prepared for two intensive weeks then a lot of self-directed writing.

Take the course if the topic is useful to your professional career, and you're able to maintain committed throughout the semester. Take the time to get to know the professors and email them regularly, they are very responsive and a great asset to our school.
